New Records: Shohei Ohtani is closing in on the first 50-50 season in major league history with 47 home runs and 48 steals.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani led off with one of the Los Angeles Dodgers’ four home runs in the first inning.
Tommy Edman hit two home runs in the game, one from each side of the plate.
Will Smith and Max Muncy also hit home runs in the opening inning.
Seiya Suzuki and Cody Bellinger hit home runs for the Cubs.
Bellinger’s three-run home run in the fifth inning helped rally Chicago into a 7-7 tie.
Gavin Lux hit a tiebreaking hit in the seventh inning.
Edman hit his second home run of the game in the eighth inning.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers avoided a three-game sweep at the hands of the Cubs.
The Dodgers remained five games up on the second-place Arizona Diamondbacks in the National League West.
The Cubs fell five games behind the New York Mets in the chase for the final NL wild-card spot.
